p: Tran et al. [ 24] quantified the content of maslinic acid ( 27) and its coumaronyl derivatives ( 28 and 29), which were potent RANKL-induced osteoclast formation inhibitors, by HPLC. The optimal condition was performed on a Sunfire C 18 column (4.6 × 150 mm, 5 μm), eluting with gradient of acetonitrile and 0.1% trifluoroacetic acid in the water, and UV lamp set at 205 nm. The content of compounds 27– 29 was determined as 7.20, 0.16, and 0.52%, respectively [ 24].
